posts.name: 2 Amy's Neapolitan Pizzeria
posts.note: Bustling wood-oven pizzeria serves innovative Neapolitan-style pies and Italian wine by the glass.

posts.name: A. Litteri's
posts.note: Old-school Italian grocery store and deli drawing foodies for meatball subs, homemade sausages and more.

posts.name: Amsterdam Falafel - Adams Morgan
posts.note: Falafel on pita bread plus Middle Eastern salads and Belgian fries at a late-night quick-serve eatery.

posts.name: Baked and Wired - Georgetown
posts.note: Artsy neighborhood bakery & coffeehouse supplying espresso drinks, big cupcakes and signature granola.

posts.name: Beefsteak *
posts.note: Fast-casual chain from José Andrés' restaurant group specializing in flavorful veggie and grain bowls.

posts.name: Ben's Chili Bowl
posts.note: Historic spot attracts locals and celebrities for the spicy hot dogs, chili-cheese fries and milkshakes.

posts.name: Big Bear Cafe
posts.note: New American restaurant with a casual interior and patio serving breakfast, lunch and candlelit dinners. I've been there on weekends for breakfast and tea.

posts.name: Buffalo and Bergen - Union Market
posts.note: From bagels to Knishes to egg creams this place has them.

posts.name: Chaia
posts.note: Chaia's 'farm to taco' is a unique relationship between farmers and urban street-style food. Chaia offers seasonal, plant-based tacos, sides and natural drinks in a stylish, casual setting.

posts.name: Chinatown Express
posts.note: Family-run Chinese joint serving handmade noodles (spun in front of the window) and dumplings.

posts.name: Cucina Al Volo
posts.note: Pick your pasta. Pick your sauce. To eat in or take home. Everything is handmade, from scratch. You need to try the lamb ragu or the rabbit ragu if they have them available.

posts.name: Daikaya - Izakaya
posts.note: Japanese noodle soups ladled out in casual, funky digs with yellow and blue walls and rustic tables.

posts.name: Dangerously Delicious Pies
posts.note: Tiny, hip bakery serving sweet & savory pies and quiches (including vegetarian/vegan options).

posts.name: Eastern Market
posts.note: Bustling marketplace since 1873 featuring a variety of produce, handmade crafts and prepared foods.

posts.name: Fast Gourmet
posts.note: Large Latin-style sandwiches are served until late at this counter at a gas station.

posts.name: Good Stuff Eatery - Capitol Hill
posts.note: Casual, multilevel upscale-industrial spot serving gourmet burgers, fries, shakes and salads.

posts.name: Hill Country Barbecue Market
posts.note: Texas BBQ and beer served in a rustic-chic, cafeteria-style setup, with nightly live music downstairs.

posts.name: Izakaya Seki
posts.note: Trendy option for Japanese small plates and noodle dishes, plus sizable beer list in minimalist digs. Try the monkfish liver if they have any it's like Foie gras.

posts.name: Jimmy T's Place *
posts.note: Quirky, no-frills dining room serving American breakfast and lunch inside a Victorian structure.

posts.name: Maketto
posts.note: Food and fashion marketplace featuring java, street food and fashion from DC-based businesses.

posts.name: Market Lunch - DC (Eastern Market)
posts.note: Famous for the blue buck blueberry pancakes and a breakfast sandwich called the brick (fried egg, cheese, potatoes, and meat on a soft roll.)

posts.name: Momofuku CCDC (City Center DC)
posts.note: David Chang offers his inventive takes on Asian fare at this airy, modern outpost next to Milk Bar.

posts.name: Naan and Beyond
posts.note: Takeaway and counter-service Indian meals draw fans to this popular, bare-bones spot. Make sure to get the veggie samosas with your meal or as a meal on their own.

posts.name: Panda Gourmet *
posts.note: Basic cafe surroundings with a full bar where spicy Sichuan fare comes from a big menu.

posts.name: Pho Viet
posts.note: Neighborhood eatery serving classic Vietnamese fare on the ground floor of a brownstone.

posts.name: Peregrine Espresso - Eastern Market
posts.note: Serious coffee sippers converge on this snug spot for carefully made espresso drinks, snacks and more.

posts.name: Peregrine Espresso - Union Market
posts.note: Considered by coffee connoisseurs as the premier place to go for a cup of delicious, micro brewed coffee.

posts.name: Red Apron - Union Market
posts.note: Counter-service spot in Union Market practicing whole-animal butchery to make charcuterie and more.

posts.name: Stachowski's Market
posts.note: Butcher shop offering fresh and cured meats and cheeses, plus sandwiches along with roast chicken to go. You need to get the four meat grinder or the Braunschweiger: house made liverwurst on rye with onions, mustard, and sweet pickles.

posts.name: Steak and Egg Kitchen
posts.note: Customers belly up to the counter or sit outside at this no-frills 24/7 breakfast and burger spot.

posts.name: Takorean - Union Market
posts.note: Union Market vendor providing fusion tacos and bowls with Korean-style BBQ fillings.

posts.name: The Pig - 14th St.
posts.note: Barn wood on the walls matches the hearty barnyard cuisine at this pork-centric New American eatery.

posts.name: Thai X-ing
posts.note: This small Thai spot uses traditional recipes and offers chef's choice menus and vegetarian specials. Plu, you need to make a reservation because they don't take walk-ins

posts.name: Thomas Sweets - Georgetown
posts.note: Well-known dessert shop dishing up small-batch ice cream plus frozen yogurt and handmade chocolates.

posts.name: Toki Underground
posts.note: Popular but snug Asian-fusion eatery known for ramen noodle soups, dumplings, sake and cocktails.

posts.name: Union Market
posts.note: Warehouse-like food market with a host of artisans offering charcuterie, empanadas, gelato and more.
